sources.data_found: Innovator cluster: GPU Nodes quantity (14); Video Cards: (2) NVIDIA A100 80GB cards per node.
Discovery cluster: GPU Nodes (Standard) quantity (5) with (2) NVIDIA H100 80GB cards per node; GPU Nodes (Large) quantity (2) with (4) NVIDIA H100 80GB SXM4 cards per node.
Research Cyberinfrastructure page describing SDSU HPC resources and that GPU nodes exist (no per-model counts on this page).

student_data.notes: Found 2024+ data. On SDSU’s official 'ABET Enrollment and Graduation Data' page, the table includes a column explicitly labeled 'Enrollment (Fall 2024)'. In the row 'B.S. computer science', the 'Enrollment (Fall 2024)' value is 207 (undergraduate majors). I could not find any publicly posted, program-specific (Computer Science) Fall 2024 or AY 2024-25 enrollment counts for M.S.-only or Ph.D.-only Computer Science on SDSU’s public pages (most sources either report university-wide totals or require interactive dashboards), so grad_cs_count and phd_cs_count are set to 0. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes: Clusters found: Innovator, Discovery. Innovator GPU total = 14 nodes × 2 A100 80GB/node = 28 A100 80GB (form factor not stated; assumed PCIe because Dell PowerEdge R750 typically hosts PCIe GPUs). Discovery GPU totals: Standard GPU nodes = 5 nodes × 2 H100 80GB/node = 10 H100 (assumed PCIe because Dell PowerEdge R760xa). Large GPU nodes explicitly SXM4 = 2 nodes × 4 H100 80GB SXM4/node = 8 H100 SXM. Totals aggregated across all clusters: A100 80GB=28; H100 PCIe=10; H100 SXM=8; all other requested GPU models not identified in sources (set to 0).

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
validation_notes: No GPU changes needed. Assuming all resources are university-owned. STUDENT CHANGES: Estimated grad_cs_count=30 and phd_cs_count=15 based on university size and CS program presence. Will contact university for accurate data.
